data.title: Kristen Stewart and Katy O’Brian Are Gay and Doing Crimes in New Queer Crime Thriller— ‘Love Lies Bleeding’ Review
data.meta_description: Rose Glass’ latest film, Love Lies Bleeding, is a departure from her debut, Saint Maud. In the same vein as cult classic Bound (1996), Love Lies Bleeding is the sapphic crime thriller that we all…
data.text:
Rose Glass’ latest film, Love Lies Bleeding, is a departure from her debut, Saint Maud. In the same vein as cult classic Bound (1996), Love Lies Bleeding is the sapphic crime thriller that we all needed. The film debuted at this year’s Sundance Film Festival to some positive reviews afterward. When I first watched the trailer for this one, I wasn’t sure what to expect but everything that took place during its entirety was not what I was expecting at all.

Set in a desert town in the middle of New Mexico, Lou (Kristen Stewart), a gym manager falls for Jackie (Katy O’Brian) a female bodybuilder. Jackie comes from Oklahoma with big dreams of getting to Las Vegas and competing in a world bodybuilding competition. Unbeknownst to Jackie, she begins waitressing at a shooting range hole-in-the-wall bar which Lou’s estranged father (Ed Harris) owns. Their love soon leads to violence as they get pulled deep into the web of Lou’s criminal family.

As soon as the film started, we were off and running with this one. This one was one wild chaotic and destructive ride! You are watching Lou and…
